lead_paragraph: Prosecutors from the office of the Manhattan district attorney took investigative authority over the crane, and inspections were ordered for all cranes at Metropolitan Transit Authority work sites.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Berger, Joseph Goldstein, Christine Haughney, Randy Leonard, Colin Moynihan and William K. Rashbaum.

snippet: Prosecutors from the office of the Manhattan district attorney took investigative authority over the crane, and inspections were ordered for all cranes at Metropolitan Transit Authority work sites....
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority shuts down all work at Midtown construction site for No. 7 subway extension after fatal crane collapse; prosecutors from the office of the Manhattan district attorney take investigative authority, ordering inspections of all cranes at MTA work sites; city officials are examining Yonkers Contracting, company that owned the 24-year-old crane that collapsed.

headline.main: Work Is Halted at Subway Site After Fatal Crane Collapse
headline.seo: M.T.A. Halts Work on Manhattan Subway Extension After a Crane Collapse
headline.print_headline: Work Is Halted at Subway Site After Fatal Crane Collapse
